title: Love to shop?
text: Then you’ll love the Plaka. Lots of stores, many sell8ng the same things, but still fun. Streets are narrow and of stone, so wear comfortable shoes. Easy to lose your way through the winding streets, but we didn’t mind.

title: Treasures
text: We enjoyed looking at the artifacts that may have been part of the Acropolis. Don’t miss the death mask of Agamemnon! Take your time.

title: Amazing!
text: I didn’t think I would be so impressed, but I was wrong. The beauty of what remains is astounding. To think these structures have survived wars, earthquakes, and millions of tourists! We went in October when the crowds were smaller and the weather was perfect. Beware it is a bit of a climb, so wear comfortable shoes and take your time. Great views of Athens too.

title: Centrally Located Gem
text: The hotel is very close to the essential sights in Athens: the Acropolis, the Parthenon, the Acropolis Archeological Museum, the Plaka for shopping, and Syntagma Square, where the changing of the guard takes place. Loads of good restaurants nearby. The service at the hotel was excellent and breakfast was delicious. There is a wine bar and restaurant directly in front of Inn Athens. Be sure to give it a try.

title: Small but comfortable
text: The hotel has a spacious lobby and breakfast room with a terrace. The breakfast was delicious. Our room was small but comfortable and very clean. We were on the first floor facing the street, so it got a little noisy in the early evening.

title: Short stay
text: Tried the hotel again. The room was better, not roomy but adequate. The web site said they allow dogs. Got there and they said no dog until I showed the desk manager the web site. Sooo, maybe they do or not. They did allow me to stay with the dog for a fee.
place: La Quinta Inn & Suites by Wyndham Brooklyn Downtown

title: Reliable, direct, on time!
text: I always try to fly JetBlue because flightsY are direct to JFK and are on time. I do pay more for more leg room. It makes a big difference getting in and out of the row. The attendants do their job s efficiently but are not that friendly. I don’t really care about that. All in all I get to my destination on time and comfortably.

title: Convenient Location
text: Houston is a big, busy city, but the downtown area is easily accessible especially if you stay at the Hampton Inn. It is very close to Minute Maid Park and the commercial center of the city. My room was very clean and spacious. The employees were friendly and accommodating. Breakfast was plentiful and tasty. There is parking available behind the hotel.

title: BBQ Without the Line
text: Rudy’s always has good BBQ especially when you’re on the way home and don’t feel like cooking. The brisket is moist and tender, the sausage spicy, and the ribs are succulent. Sides are nothing special, but they’re not the main event. Their catering is affordable and ready on time.

title: Tapas and wine!
text:
Tasty tapas especially the capers sandwich, bruschetta with mushrooms and cheese, pulled pork sliders, and the green salad wit spring peas. Good selection of wines to accompany the tapas. Go into their charming garden and enjoy your wine.
The owner and his staff are very friendly and accommodating. I hosted a family and friends party, which we thoroughly enjoyed. Looking forward to my next visit.

title: The Way Bagels Hould Be
text: Crispy on the outside and soft inside. They pu just the right amount of butter or cream cheese A variety of bagels available.

title: Can’t keep it a secret
text: I shouldn’t be writing this because it’s a small restaurant, and you might make the line longer! Yes, there’s a line most nights but it moves quickly and better during the week. This is the best ramen I’ve had, said even after a recent trip to Japan. The broth has been cooked low and slow to develop deep rich flavor. Then fresh ramen, vegetables, a little pork or not, and an egg are slipped in. Great flavors combine to create a warm, satisfying soup. A lot of slurping going on at Ramen Tatsu-Ya but totally expected and acceptable. Good Japanese beer too. The restaurant is in a small shopping center on Research Blvd. Maybe you won’t find it but you can imagine me happily slurping away. Just kidding....give it a try!

title: Baseball Fans Nirvana
text: Every baseball fan has to visit the Hall of Fame! Every team is adequately represented, but the stars are prominently featured. We were reminded of the enduring records of Babe Ruth, Christy Mattheson, Lou Gehrig, Jackie Robinson, just o name a few. A small exhibition of women's professional teams is included. Worth the time but only for real fans!
place: National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum

title: Great homemade Italian food
text: Delicious papardelle Bolognese with homemade pasta and short ribs. Antipasto and Caesar salads were generous portions and delicious.

title: Quintessential Austin
text: Great Mexican food rather than Tex-Mex. I've eaten here twice and loved the drinks, food, and service. The restaurant offers a variety of margaritas but try the mojitos too. I recommend the chicken mole and rellenos. Other members of our party enjoyed the fish and shrimp dishes as well. The waiters are knowledgeable and happy to recommend dishes especially for those diners who do not enjoy spicy food. The decor and atmosphere will remind you of old Mexico.

title: Concert Venue
text: Unfortunately, it's quite a distance from Austin, traffic is often terrible. There is plenty of parking and shuttles from the lots. The lawn area is great, but there is also plenty of comfortable seating. Food is mostly food truck fare. The two concerts I saw were great with two large screens for those not close to the stage.

title: A bit of Texas history
text: The guided tour provides you with a comprehensive history of the building. It is made of rose granite with plenty of ornate de oration inside. The desks in the senate and congress are original. Portraits of former governors line the rotunda and floors above. Elevators available..

title: Austin Landmark
text:
Great Tex-Mex food with friendly, knowledgeable waiters. Try the chicken mole!
It is a large restaurant, so when it's busy like Friday and Saturday nights, it can be very noisy. Ask for a patio table.

title: Amazing glass sculptures
text: I have never seen such spectacular colors and size. Chihuly is an amazing artist who now guides other to create his works. It's very convenient to visit the site right at the base of the Space Needle.

title: Austin at its finest.
text: Great place for a leisurely walk with your dog or a run around the lake. The lake is beautiful and serene. The only drawback is the number of runners and bikers on a warm day. Weekdays are best.

title: Worth a visit.
text: If you don't have a lot of time, this museum allows you to still visit an art exhibit. The exhibits change frequently and are thematic.

title: The beauty of Texas
text: The best place to see Texas wild flowers in all their glory. Of course, spring is the best time to go, but you can learn about flowers any time of the year. It's a short trip south of Austin and definitely worth it. Activities for kids too.

title: A place to visit more than once!
text: One of the most amazing places in Texas. Part of Big Bend National Park, Santa Elens Canyon is right on the border of Mexico. The Rio Grande River flows between the canyon walls. The river was low when I was there but must be higher now after the May rains. Beautiful weather in February, but it is chilly in the mornings. be sure to wear your walking shoes if you want to hike along the canyon wall.

title: Great overview
text:
if you're new to Texas, visitibg the Bullock TexasState History Museum will introduce you to the many different terrains, cultures, and products of the state. Don't miss the 15 minute film. It will make you want to see more of this huge state.
I look forward to seeing more special exhibitions.

title: Loved the Rastabus��
text: This is a terrific way to see Los Angeles. We got a great overview, so we could decide where to explored in depth. Our guide was very knowledgeable about the history of the city as well as all the famous homes, comedy clubs, and restaurants. He was very entertaining, which made our tour so much fun. They provided us with water...a must in sunny LA. Had lunch at the Farmer's Market before ending the tour in Santa Monica near the pier. It's an all day tour, so be prepared!
place: Full-Day Iconic Sights of LA, Hollywood, Beverly Hills, Beaches and More
